title: How Fabric Absorbs Color
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on How Fabric Absorbs Color.

hook.text: Cotton and silk dipped in the same dye produce completely different colors.

buildup.text: Natural fibers have different molecular structures that grab dye molecules differently.

discovery.text: Cotton needs mordantsâ€”chemical helpersâ€”to bond with most dyes permanently.

twist.text: Synthetic fabrics like polyester require entirely different dye chemistry under pressure.

climax.text: A single color formula must be reformulated for every fabric type.

punchline.text: The same red isn't the same red. It depends what it touches.

quiz.question: Why does cotton need mordants in the dyeing process?
options: To help dye molecules bond permanently to the fiber
